intro: Anathallis fernandiana, commonly known as the São Paulo mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, red berries. Anathallis fernandiana is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its forest habitat.
